subject: Re: [rt.debian.org #108] access to saens rsyncd for ftp.cl.d.o
body:
On Thu, 2007-06-28 at 16:51 +0200, Josip Rodin wrote:
> On Thu, Jun 28, 2007 at 09:59:19AM -0400, Ricardo Yanez wrote:
> > > Can we plug him into syncproxy.wna.d.o instead? The Oregon university,
> > > like the Michigan one, is on Abilene, which peers with RedCLARA, so the
> > > link quality should be similar.
> > >
> > 
> > When do you think I could get an answer regarding this?
> > 
> > It's been almost a week now since saens stopped updating and we are as far
> > behind as them. The Mexican mirror appeared recently and they got access
> > to the sync proxy right away. Why this treatment? We have been official
> > since 2002 and I have not ever got a direct reply to my requests to get a
> > more privileged access. It's getting ridiculous and frankly I'm getting
> > tired of this treatment.
> > 
> > Sorry for the burst, I know it's not your fault.
> 
> Please send this to mirrors@debian.org so that the responsible people see
> it.
> 
> Indeed, I'd actually Cc: debian-mirrors@lists so that it goes public,
> because it's completely devoid of reason for the Mexicans to get in
> so speedily (they have been running that mirror for a long time,
> but it was still fast-tracked for no real reason) while you and
> the Brazilians are be pretty much ignored.

Done.
Ricardo Yanez


-- 
To UNSUBSCRIBE, email to debian-mirrors-REQUEST@lists.debian.org
with a subject of "unsubscribe". Trouble? Contact listmaster@lists.debian.org
